aeon.preprocess package

Submodules

aeon.preprocess.api module

aeon.preprocess.api.aeon(seconds)[source]

Converts a Harp timestamp, in seconds, to a datetime object.

aeon.preprocess.api.annotationreader(file)[source]

Reads session annotations from the specified file.

aeon.preprocess.api.annotations(path, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts session metadata from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating event times of manual annotations in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the session data is stored.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing annotation metadata, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.distancetravelled(angle, radius=4.0)[source]

Calculates the total distance travelled on the wheel, by taking into account its radius and the total number of turns in both directions across time.

Parameters

  • angle (Series) – A series of magnetic encoder measurements.

  • radius (float) – The radius of the wheel, in metric units.

Returns

The total distance travelled on the wheel, in metric units.

aeon.preprocess.api.encoderdata(path, device, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all encoder data from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, from the specified patch controller in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the data is stored.

  • device (str) – The device name used to search for data files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

Returns

A pandas data frame containing encoder data, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.exportvideo(frames, file, fps, fourcc=None)[source]

Exports the specified frame sequence to a new video file.

Parameters

  • frames (iterable) – An object to iterate over the raw video frame data.

  • file (str) – The path to the exported video file.

  • fps – The frame rate of the exported video.

  • fourcc (optional) –

Specifies the four character code of the codec used to compress the frames.

aeon.preprocess.api.harpdata(path, device, register, names=None, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all harp data from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, for an individual register acquired from a device in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the data is stored.

  • device (str) – The device name used to search for data files.

  • register (int) – The register number to extract data for.

  • names (str or array-like) – The optional column labels to use for the data.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing harp event data, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.harpreader(file, names=None)[source]

Reads Harp data from the specified file.

Parameters

  • file (str) – The path to a Harp binary file.

  • names (str or array-like) – The optional column labels to use for the data.

Returns

A pandas data frame containing harp event data, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.load(path, reader, device, prefix=None, extension='*.csv', start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts data from matching files in the specified root path, sorted chronologically, containing device and/or session metadata for the Experiment 0 arena. If no prefix is specified, metadata for all sessions is extracted.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the session data is stored.

  • reader (callable) – A callable object used to load session metadata from a file.

  • device (str,) – The device name prefix used to search for data files.

  • prefix (str, optional) – The pathname prefix used to search for data files.

  • extension (str, optional) – The optional extension pattern used to search for data files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing session event metadata, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.patchdata(path, patch, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts patch metadata from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating wheel threshold, d1 and delta state changes in the arena patch.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the session data is stored.

  • patch (str) – The patch name used to search for data files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing patch state metadata, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.patchreader(file)[source]

Reads patch state metadata from the specified file.

aeon.preprocess.api.payloadtypes = {1: dtype('uint8'), 2: dtype('uint16'), 4: dtype('uint32'), 8: dtype('uint64'), 68: dtype('float32'), 129: dtype('int8'), 130: dtype('int16'), 132: dtype('int32'), 136: dtype('int64')}

Map of Harp device registers used in the Experiment 1 arena.

aeon.preprocess.api.pelletdata(path, device, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all pellet event data from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating when delivery of a pellet was triggered and when pellets were detected by the feeder beam break.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the session data is stored.

  • device (str) – The device name used to search for data files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

Returns

A pandas data frame containing pellet event data, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.positiondata(path, device='FrameTop', start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all position data from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, for the specified camera in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the data is stored.

  • device (str) – The device name used to search for data files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing position data, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.sessiondata(path, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all session metadata from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating start and end times of manual sessions in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the session data is stored.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing session event metadata, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.sessionduration(data)[source]

Computes duration and summary metadata for each session, by subtracting the start and end times. Allows for missing data by trying to match session start times with subsequent end times. If the match fails, end session metadata is filled with NaN.

Parameters

data (DataFrame) – A pandas data frame containing session event metadata.

Returns

A pandas data frame containing duration and metadata for each session.

aeon.preprocess.api.sessionreader(file)[source]

Reads session metadata from the specified file.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebin(time)[source]

Returns the whole hour time bin for a measurement timestamp.

Parameters

time (datetime or Series) – An object or series specifying the measurement timestamps.

Returns

A datetime object or series specifying the time bin for the measurement timestamp.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebin_filter(files, timefilter)[source]

Filters a list of paths using the specified time filter. To use the time filter, files must conform to a naming convention where the timestamp of each timebin is appended to the end of each file path.

Parameters

  • files (str) – The list of timebin files to filter.

  • timefilter (iterable or callable) –

A list of time bins or a predicate used to test each file time. :return: A list of all matching filenames.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebin_key(file)[source]

Returns the time bin key for the specified file name.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebin_range(start, end)[source]

Returns a range of whole hour time bins.

Parameters

  • start (datetime) – The left bound of the time range.

  • end (datetime) – The right bound of the time range.

Returns

A DatetimeIndex representing the range of time bins.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebindata(path, device, extension='*.csv', start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all timebin information from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating recorded timebins for the specified device in the arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the data is stored.

  • device (str,) – The device name prefix used to search for timebin files.

  • extension (str, optional) – The optional extension pattern used to search for timebin files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing timebin information, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.timebinreader(file)[source]

Reads timebin information for the specified file.

aeon.preprocess.api.videoclip(path, device, start=None, end=None)[source]

Extracts information about a continuous segment of video, possibly stored across multiple video files. For each video file covering the segment, a row is returned containing the path, start frame, and duration of the segment stored in that file.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the video data is stored.

  • device (str,) – The device prefix used to search for video files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

Returns

A pandas data frame containing video clip storage information.

aeon.preprocess.api.videodata(path, device, start=None, end=None, time=None, tolerance=None)[source]

Extracts all video metadata from the specified root path, sorted chronologically, indicating synchronized trigger frame times for cameras in the Experiment 0 arena.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The root path where all the video data is stored.

  • device (str,) – The device prefix used to search for video files.

  • start (datetime, optional) – The left bound of the time range to extract.

  • end (datetime, optional) – The right bound of the time range to extract.

  • time (datetime, optional) – An object or series specifying the timestamps to extract.

  • tolerance (datetime, optional) –

The maximum distance between original and new timestamps for inexact matches. :return: A pandas data frame containing frame event metadata, sorted by time.

aeon.preprocess.api.videoframes(data)[source]

Extracts the raw frames corresponding to the provided video metadata.

Parameters

data (DataFrame) –

A pandas DataFrame where each row specifies video acquisition path and frame number. :return: An object to iterate over numpy arrays for each row in the DataFrame, containing the raw video frame data.

aeon.preprocess.api.videoreader(file)[source]

Reads video metadata from the specified file.
